item.title: DAVE THE DIVER – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition now available
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

A free upgrade from the Switch version.

MINTROCKET has released single-player adventure RPG DAVE THE DIVER – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition for Switch 2 via Nintendo eShop. It is available at a launch discount price of $11.99 until November 13, after which it will cost $19.99. Users who own the Switch version can upgrade to the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition via a free upgrade pack.

The Switch 2 version of DAVE THE DIVER offers higher resolution and improved frame rates over the Switch version. No other changes were made to the content of the game.

DAVE THE DIVER is currently available for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store. A major downloadable content, “In the Jungle,” is currently in development.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/dave-the-diver-nintendo-switch-2-edition-now-available

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A DLC ‘Mega Dimension’ launches December 10
item.content:encoded:
• Switch
  • Switch 2

Plus a new side mission featuring Diancie.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A downloadable content “Mega Dimension” will launch on December 10 for $29.99 / 3,000 yen, publisher The Pokemon Company and developer Game Freak announced.

Get the latest details below.

Venturing into Hyperspace Lumiose

In Pokemon Legends: Z-A “Mega Dimension,” Trainers will revisit Lumiose as spatial distortions begin to form around the city. Donut chef Ansha and her companion, the Mythical Pokemon Hoopa, will guide players as they explore the mysterious dimension known as Hyperspace Lumiose. This not-quite Lumiose City is home to newly discovered Mega-Evolved Pokemon and other Pokemon not usually found in Lumiose, some of which can exceed the normal limit of Lv. 100 with hyperspace levels.

Hoopa’s powers are awakened when it receives one of Ansha’s donuts, transforming the distortions into portals to hyperspace. Ansha uses Berries to create various kinds of donuts that grant different effects in hyperspace, such as powering up your Pokemon. She can also use more potent Hyperspace Berries, which are useful for taking on the high-level Pokemon in Hyperspace Lumiose.

Trainers will be joined by new allies such as Korrina, a successor to a line of Mega Evolution gurus determined to encounter every Mega-Evolved Pokemon. Together with Team MZ, players will explore Hyperspace Lumiose, uncover its secrets, and tackle the strange events befalling Lumiose City.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Newly Discovered Mega-Evolved Pokemon

Mega Chimecho and Mega Baxcalibur will make their debut in Pokemon Legends: Z-A “Mega Dimension.”

When Chimecho Mega Evolves, six smaller copies appear and flutter endlessly, even when no wind is blowing. When Chimecho cries, the echoes of its copies overlap and resonate, creating an intense sound-wave attack that can overwhelm any opponent.

Baxcalibur becomes even more formidable thanks to Mega Evolution, generating more ice energy and wielding a back blade that has grown larger and more powerful. With the sheer weight of this blade, it can cleave or smash nearly anything in its path. Players can obtain the Mega Stone needed to evolve Baxcalibur from the Z-A Battle Club as a reward for advancing in online Ranked Battles.

Extra Side Mission Now Available to Get Mythical Pokemon Diancie in Pokemon Legends: Z-A

Beginning Thursday, November 6, players can claim a Diancite Stone through the Mystery Gift feature[4] in the Pokemon Legends: Z-A base game. This Diancite stone unlocks an opportunity to encounter and catch the Jewel Pokemon Diancie through an extra side mission titled “Shine Bright like a Gemstone.”

Once Trainers have claimed their Diancite via Mystery Gift, they can visit the Looker Bureau, where Mimi the Espurr—Emma’s partner Pokemon—will take a special interest in the Mega Stone, setting an extra side mission in motion. Completing this mission allows players to add Diancie to their team, then use the Diancite stone to Mega Evolve it into Mega Diancie, unveiling its radiant Mega Evolution in battle.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A is available now for Switch 2 and Switch.

Watch the trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

DLC “Mega Dimension” Release Date Trailer

English

Japanese

Get Diancie and a Diancite Stone

English

Japanese



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/pokemon-legends-z-a-dlc-mega-dimension-launches-december-10

item.title: Overcooked 2! – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition now available
item.content:encoded:
Publisher Team17 and developer Ghost Town Games have released Overcooked! 2 – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition for $29.99 / £24.99 / €29.99. Users who own the Switch version can upgrade to the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition for $9.99 / £7.99 / €9.99.

Overcooked! 2 first launched for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, PC, Mac, and Linux on August 7, 2018, followed by Luna on October 20, 2020, Xbox Series on November 10, 2020, and PlayStation 5 on November 12, 2020. The PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series versions are available via the Overcooked! All You Can Eat, which includes both Overcooked! and Overcooked! 2 and all downloadable content. Overcooked! All You Can Eat is also available for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC.

Here is an overview of the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition, via Team17:

You’ll knead to work together to cook up a storm in the worldwide sensations’ newest iteration—cook, chop, and communicate your way through the Onion Kingdom in your trusty food van to prepare delicacies from copious cuisines to stave of the unending hunger of the Unbread hordes!

Now, I won’t overegg it but, with this new version of Overcooked! 2, we’ve stripped out the old kitchen and installed a bunch of brand-new exclusive Nintendo Switch 2 appliances, such as:

  • Enhanced graphics in-line with PC.
  • 4K resolution / 60 frames per second gameplay when docked—enjoy those kitchen fires in 4K.
  • Camera Play—enjoy all the laughter and joy on your friends’ faces as you trek across the Onion Kingdom. Know exactly who to scream at for help when the burger you’ve been grilling has been thrown away!
  • Game Share—Bring new chefs to your team, even those without a copy of Overcooked! 2 can play both locally and online as long as one of you has your kitchen tools ready!
  • And may we introduce you to the newest member of the Kitchen Crew: The Pristine Platinum Platypus!

Chefs will still be able to play with Nintendo Switch players and any downloadable content you already own will remain. For those worrying about save files and losing your treasured three stars, have no fear! progression can be transferred back and forth between both platforms.

For one week after launch, you can get the early bird special! 20 percent off both the upgrade and new edition for those ready to jump into the kitchen while the frying pan is sizzling!

Watch a new trailer below.

Launch Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/overcooked-2-nintendo-switch-2-edition-now-available

item.title: Pirates Outlaws II: Heritage launches in Early Access on December 4 for PC, later in December for iOS and Android
item.content:encoded:
Roguelike deckbuilder sequel Pirates Outlaws II: Heritage will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam on December 4, followed by PC via Epic Games Store, and iOS and Android later in December, developer Fabled Game Studio announced.

“In the Early Access version, your adventure starts in The New Elysia,” reads the announcement. “Navigate with heroes and classes, build your deck, sail from isle to isle, and defeat enemies. Conquest the Arena to be a reputed captain.”

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Pirates Outlaws II: Heritage is a roguelike deckbuilder card game. Collect and fuse cards to evolve, gather relics for outfit bonus and design your own strategy. Become reputed, loot the Sea Masters, challenge giant creatures and triumph the great Arena!

Key Features

  • Exclusive Journey – In the family mansion, prepare for your expedition by selecting a pre-made character starter deck, complete with unique hero ability cards. These abilities are acquired and unlocked through various alchemy potions.
  • Adventure with Companions – Recruit companions and add their unique ability cards to your starter deck. Create complementary strategies!
  • Explore Endless Seas – During your journey, carefully plan your route and rations to avoid sinking. Navigate freely from battle to battle or return to any previously visited island, tavern, or market.
  • Search for Deep-Sea Treasures – The game features a vast collection of cards and relics, as well as a wide range of enemies and creatures to defeat.
  • Fusion of Cards – Each card offers various upgrade options. When you collect three identical cards, they fuse to create a higher level one.
  • Unlocking Mystic Powers – Relics provide effects that enhance the bearer. You can find them during events or purchase them in the market. Complete an outfit to gain its passive effect.
  • Customized Appearance – After each expedition, use the gold you’ve earned to unlock and customize characters’ appearance.

Watch a new trailer below.

Early Access Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/pirates-outlaws-ii-heritage-launches-in-early-access-on-december-4-for-pc-later-in-december-for-ios-and-android

item.title: Famitsu Sales: 10/27/25 – 11/2/25
item.content:encoded:
• PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake opens at 413,518 retail sales.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for week of October 27, 2025 to November 2, 2025.

Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake was the highest selling new game release, opening at 232,250 units on Switch, 96,812 units on PlayStation 5, and 84,456 units on Switch 2 for an opening week total of 413,518 retail copies sold.

Also new this week, Tales of Xillia Remastered debuted at 10,370 sales on Switch and 7,290 sales on PlayStation 5 for an opening week total of 17,660 retail copies sold.

On the hardware side, Switch 2 sold 83,825 units, the Switch family sold 26,708 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 7537 units, the Xbox Series family sold 309 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 19 units.

Get the full sales charts below.

Software Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. [NSW] Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake (Square Enix, 10/30/25) – 232,250 (New)
  2. [PS5] Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake (Square Enix, 10/30/25) – 96,812 (New)
  3. [SW2] Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake (Square Enix, 10/30/25) – 84,456 (New)
  4. [NSW] Pokemon Legends: Z-A (The Pokemon Company, 10/16/25) – 82,812 (1,150,583)
  5. [SW2] Mario Kart World (Nintendo, 06/05/25) – 50,845 (2,017,414)

  7. [NSW] Tales of Xillia Remastered (Bandai Namco, 10/30/25) – 10,370 (New)
